diff_hunk:
@@ -1,70 +1,43 @@
-import sys as _sys
-import multiprocessing as _mp
+import sys
+from .reductions import init_reductions
+import multiprocessing
 
+__all__ = ['set_sharing_strategy', 'get_sharing_strategy',
+           'get_all_sharing_strategies']
 
-class _TorchContext(object):
-    def __init__(self, ctx=None, sharing_strategy=None):
-        if ctx is None:
-            ctx = _mp
-        if sharing_strategy is None:
-            if _sys.platform == 'darwin':
-                sharing_strategy = 'file_system'
-            else:
-                sharing_strategy = 'file_descriptor'
-        if sharing_strategy not in self.get_all_sharing_strategies():
-            raise ValueError("invalid sharing_strategy '{}'".format(sharing_strategy))
-        self._ctx = ctx
-        self._sharing_strategy = sharing_strategy
+globals().update((name, getattr(multiprocessing, name))
body:
Yeah, that's probably better. I was mimicking this code from CPython but it's copying attributes from an object instead of a module:
https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/c30098c8c6014f3340a369a31df9c74bdbacc269/Lib/multiprocessing/__init__.py#L22-L23
